title: "Exploring the Mysteries of Perception: Communication and Visualization"
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author describes the gradual transition from a foggy image to complete darkness, where the contours of physical objects are outlined by a luminous, strange light that spans the iridescent spectrum. In this final part, the author explores how concentration exercises can lead to the ability to communicate and see distant people, claim past events, and gain a clear vision of the future. The author also notes how the person evoked in this manner does not speak, and the operator only has a clear consciousness with a feeling, almost like a vibration of the words. Additionally, the author describes how with increasing concentration, the operator can witness a luminous center forming in complete darkness, ultimately overpowering it.
content: Con el mismo medio es fácil el reclamar sucesos pasados, como puede tener una visión clarísima del futuro. Es importante notar como las figuras evocadas no hablan, lo que es bien obvio, todavía el operado tiene clarísima consciencia, y siente, casi, el sonido de las palabras vibrar dentro de sí. Fácilmente se podrá ver el proprio cuerpo y los otros casi como una masa de un color gris oscuro, más intenso aquí o allá, circundado enteramente de una luz levemente luminosa. La visión más o menos rápida de las varias graduaciones luminosas termina con la percepción de la oscuridad completa en la cual la consciencia del operador parece como disolverse; si persiste y no se retrae, sino que intensifica el modo del experimento, entonces, poco a poco, en la oscuridad absoluta se verá formar un pequeño centro levemente luminoso que poco a poco brillara mayormente hasta vencer completamente la oscuridad.
last_phrase: In conclusion, through perseverance and practice, one can unlock a new and wondrous world of perception. However, it is essential to remain firm and impassive in the face of potential danger and monstrosities. Further inner observations, including the subtle sensations of vertigo, should be explored and mastered through willpower. With dedication and diligence, one can expand their perception beyond the limits of the physical world.
